trans-unit.source: Versioning for the Azure Storage Services
trans-unit.target: Versioning for the Azure Storage Services

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure storage services support multiple versions.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure storage services support multiple versions.

trans-unit.source: To make a request against the storage services, you must specify the version that you want to use for that operation, unless the request is anonymous.
trans-unit.target: To make a request against the storage services, you must specify the version that you want to use for that operation, unless the request is anonymous.

trans-unit.source: The current version of the Azure storage services is 2015-02-21, and using that version is recommended where possible.
trans-unit.target: The current version of the Azure storage services is 2015-02-21, and using that version is recommended where possible.

trans-unit.source: For a list of all other supported versions, and for information about using each version, see <link xlink:href="2279856c-ff44-4560-bfa5-b03ae644c0af" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services (Version 2013-08-15 and earlier)</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of all other supported versions, and for information about using each version, see <link xlink:href="2279856c-ff44-4560-bfa5-b03ae644c0af" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services (Version 2013-08-15 and earlier)</link>.

trans-unit.source: Version 2015-02-21
trans-unit.target: Version 2015-02-21

trans-unit.source: Version 2015-02-21 includes these changes:
trans-unit.target: Version 2015-02-21 includes these changes:

trans-unit.source: A new blob type, the <legacyItalic>append blob</legacyItalic>, is now available.
trans-unit.target: A new blob type, the <legacyItalic>append blob</legacyItalic>, is now available.

trans-unit.source: All writes to an append blob are added sequentially to the end of the blob, making it optimal for logging scenarios.
trans-unit.target: All writes to an append blob are added sequentially to the end of the blob, making it optimal for logging scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Append blobs support an <link xlink:href="08d3ac04-23b4-4d39-9c40-06a38bdc6df1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Append Block</link> operation for adding blocks to the blob.
trans-unit.target: Append blobs support an <link xlink:href="08d3ac04-23b4-4d39-9c40-06a38bdc6df1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Append Block</link> operation for adding blocks to the blob.

trans-unit.source: Once a block is added with <languageKeyword>Append Block</languageKeyword>, it is immediately available to be read; no further commits are necessary.
trans-unit.target: Once a block is added with <languageKeyword>Append Block</languageKeyword>, it is immediately available to be read; no further commits are necessary.

trans-unit.source: The block cannot be modified once it has been added.
trans-unit.target: The block cannot be modified once it has been added.

trans-unit.source: A number of new features are available for the Azure File service, including:
trans-unit.target: A number of new features are available for the Azure File service, including:

trans-unit.source: New operations on the File service, including <link xlink:href="83f88647-53d3-4d81-937c-39b432dfde75" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get File Service Properties</link>, <link xlink:href="bb492133-44d1-4f75-9928-d5d03924d7eb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set File Service Properties</link>, and <link xlink:href="d44688ba-efad-41cb-b9dc-071841033ee2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Preflight File Request</link>.
trans-unit.target: New operations on the File service, including <link xlink:href="83f88647-53d3-4d81-937c-39b432dfde75" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get File Service Properties</link>, <link xlink:href="bb492133-44d1-4f75-9928-d5d03924d7eb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set File Service Properties</link>, and <link xlink:href="d44688ba-efad-41cb-b9dc-071841033ee2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Preflight File Request</link>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Preflight File Request</languageKeyword> operation enables CORS support for Azure files.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Preflight File Request</languageKeyword> operation enables CORS support for Azure files.

trans-unit.source: Usage data for a file share, via the <link xlink:href="6b825cb1-53ec-4bbc-ba90-fb46f4477da9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Share Stats</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Usage data for a file share, via the <link xlink:href="6b825cb1-53ec-4bbc-ba90-fb46f4477da9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Share Stats</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Support for shared access signatures for shares and files.
trans-unit.target: Support for shared access signatures for shares and files.

trans-unit.source: New <link xlink:href="9316b0ba-e1a4-43f1-b991-e321fbaea7ab" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Share ACL</link> and <link xlink:href="032f3a38-db93-4673-ac7e-0434311e1240" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Share ACL</link> operations, for managing shared access policies on a share.
trans-unit.target: New <link xlink:href="9316b0ba-e1a4-43f1-b991-e321fbaea7ab" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Share ACL</link> and <link xlink:href="032f3a38-db93-4673-ac7e-0434311e1240" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Share ACL</link> operations, for managing shared access policies on a share.

trans-unit.source: New <link xlink:href="933b4b8f-9f33-451d-a50f-1a8f8fe5da98" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Directory Metadata</link> and <link xlink:href="920af977-b511-42de-9a1a-9326575e1c94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Directory Metadata</link> operations.
trans-unit.target: New <link xlink:href="933b4b8f-9f33-451d-a50f-1a8f8fe5da98" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Directory Metadata</link> and <link xlink:href="920af977-b511-42de-9a1a-9326575e1c94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Directory Metadata</link> operations.

trans-unit.source: New <link xlink:href="9108f963-eba1-4148-a00e-2d051bca4487" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy File</link> and <link xlink:href="f1e6bf99-bdf7-4fd7-bb8f-c3c0db0b63d8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Abort Copy File</link> operations.
trans-unit.target: New <link xlink:href="9108f963-eba1-4148-a00e-2d051bca4487" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy File</link> and <link xlink:href="f1e6bf99-bdf7-4fd7-bb8f-c3c0db0b63d8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Abort Copy File</link> operations.

trans-unit.source: For version 2015-02-21 and later only, when constructing the string-to-sign for a shared access signature for the Blob, Table, Queue, and File services, you must include the service name in the canonicalized resource portion of the string.
trans-unit.target: For version 2015-02-21 and later only, when constructing the string-to-sign for a shared access signature for the Blob, Table, Queue, and File services, you must include the service name in the canonicalized resource portion of the string.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="2686d543-29ff-4b60-a2c0-a505f421ebf9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Constructing the Shared Access Signature URI</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="2686d543-29ff-4b60-a2c0-a505f421ebf9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Constructing the Shared Access Signature URI</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: For version 2015-02-21 and later only, when constructing the string-to-sign, omit the value of the <parameterReference>Content-Length</parameterReference> header from the string-to-sign when that value is zero.
trans-unit.target: For version 2015-02-21 and later only, when constructing the string-to-sign, omit the value of the <parameterReference>Content-Length</parameterReference> header from the string-to-sign when that value is zero.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication for the Azure Storage Services</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication for the Azure Storage Services</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Specifying Storage Service Versions in Requests
trans-unit.target: Specifying Storage Service Versions in Requests

trans-unit.source: How you specify the version of the storage services to use for a request relates to how that request is authenticated.
trans-unit.target: How you specify the version of the storage services to use for a request relates to how that request is authenticated.

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe authentication options and how the service version is specified for each:
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe authentication options and how the service version is specified for each:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Requests using Shared Key or Shared Key Lite.</embeddedLabel> To authenticate a request with Shared Key/Shared Key Lite, you must pass the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header on the request.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Requests using Shared Key or Shared Key Lite.</embeddedLabel> To authenticate a request with Shared Key/Shared Key Lite, you must pass the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header on the request.

trans-unit.source: In the case of the Blob service, you can specify the default version for all requests by calling <link xlink:href="65424a3c-ab49-4994-865c-827409598092" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Blob Service Properties</link>.
trans-unit.target: In the case of the Blob service, you can specify the default version for all requests by calling <link xlink:href="65424a3c-ab49-4994-865c-827409598092" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Blob Service Properties</link>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Requests using a Shared Access Signature (SAS).</embeddedLabel> You can specify two versioning options on a shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Requests using a Shared Access Signature (SAS).</embeddedLabel> You can specify two versioning options on a shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: If specified, the optional <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> header indicates which service version to use to execute the API operation.
trans-unit.target: If specified, the optional <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> header indicates which service version to use to execute the API operation.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> parameter specifies the service version to use to authorize and authenticate the request made with the SAS.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> parameter specifies the service version to use to authorize and authenticate the request made with the SAS.

trans-unit.source: If the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> header is not specified, then the value of the <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> parameter also indicates the version to use to execute the API operation.
trans-unit.target: If the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> header is not specified, then the value of the <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> parameter also indicates the version to use to execute the API operation.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Requests using anonymous access.</embeddedLabel> In the case of anonymous access against the Blob service, no version is passed in; the heuristics for which version is used for the request are described below.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Requests using anonymous access.</embeddedLabel> In the case of anonymous access against the Blob service, no version is passed in; the heuristics for which version is used for the request are described below.

trans-unit.source: Requests Authenticated Using Shared Key/Shared Key Lite
trans-unit.target: Requests Authenticated Using Shared Key/Shared Key Lite

trans-unit.source: To authenticate a request with Shared Key/Shared Key Lite, specify the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header on the request.
trans-unit.target: To authenticate a request with Shared Key/Shared Key Lite, specify the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header on the request.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> request header value must be specified in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> request header value must be specified in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The following rules indicates how requests using Shared Key/Shared Key Lite are evaluated to determine the version to use in processing the request.
trans-unit.target: The following rules indicates how requests using Shared Key/Shared Key Lite are evaluated to determine the version to use in processing the request.

trans-unit.source: If a request has a valid <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header, the storage service uses the specified version.
trans-unit.target: If a request has a valid <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header, the storage service uses the specified version.

trans-unit.source: All requests to the Table and Queue services that do not use a shared access signature must specify an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header.
trans-unit.target: All requests to the Table and Queue services that do not use a shared access signature must specify an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header.

trans-unit.source: All requests to the Blob service that do not use a shared access signature must specify an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header unless the default version has been set, as described below.
trans-unit.target: All requests to the Blob service that do not use a shared access signature must specify an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header unless the default version has been set, as described below.

trans-unit.source: If a request to the Blob service does not have an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header, but the account owner has set a default version using <link xlink:href="65424a3c-ab49-4994-865c-827409598092" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Blob Service Properties</link>, then the specified default version is used as the version for the request.
trans-unit.target: If a request to the Blob service does not have an <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header, but the account owner has set a default version using <link xlink:href="65424a3c-ab49-4994-865c-827409598092" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Blob Service Properties</link>, then the specified default version is used as the version for the request.

trans-unit.source: Requests Authenticated With a Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Requests Authenticated With a Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: A shared access signature (SAS) generated using version 2014-02-14 or later supports two versioning options:
trans-unit.target: A shared access signature (SAS) generated using version 2014-02-14 or later supports two versioning options:

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> query parameter defines the REST protocol version to use for processing a request made using the SAS.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> query parameter defines the REST protocol version to use for processing a request made using the SAS.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> query parameter defines the SAS version to use for authentication and authorization.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>SignedVersion (sv)</parameterReference> query parameter defines the SAS version to use for authentication and authorization.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> query parameter is used for authentication and authorization when a client makes a request using the SAS.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> query parameter is used for authentication and authorization when a client makes a request using the SAS.

trans-unit.source: Authentication and authorization parameters such as <parameterReference>si</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>sr</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>sp</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>sig</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>st</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>se</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>tn</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>spk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>srk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>epk</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>erk</parameterReference> are all interpreted using version 2014-02-14.
trans-unit.target: Authentication and authorization parameters such as <parameterReference>si</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>sr</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>sp</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>sig</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>st</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>se</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>tn</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>spk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>srk</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>epk</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>erk</parameterReference> are all interpreted using version 2014-02-14.

trans-unit.source: REST protocol parameters such as <parameterReference>rscc</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>rscd</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>rsce</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>rscl</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>rsct</parameterReference> are enforced using the version provided in the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter header.
trans-unit.target: REST protocol parameters such as <parameterReference>rscc</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>rscd</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>rsce</parameterReference>, <parameterReference>rscl</parameterReference>, and <parameterReference>rsct</parameterReference> are enforced using the version provided in the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter header.

trans-unit.source: If the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> header is not specified, then the service version provided for <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> is used.
trans-unit.target: If the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> header is not specified, then the service version provided for <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> is used.

trans-unit.source: Note that the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter is not part of the string-to-sign in the authentication as described in <link xlink:href="2686d543-29ff-4b60-a2c0-a505f421ebf9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Constructing the Shared Access Signature URI</link>.
trans-unit.target: Note that the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter is not part of the string-to-sign in the authentication as described in <link xlink:href="2686d543-29ff-4b60-a2c0-a505f421ebf9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Constructing the Shared Access Signature URI</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following table explains the versioning scheme used by the service for authentication and authorization and for calling the REST protocol when the <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> parameter is set to version 2014-02-14 or later.
trans-unit.target: The following table explains the versioning scheme used by the service for authentication and authorization and for calling the REST protocol when the <parameterReference>SignedVersion</parameterReference> parameter is set to version 2014-02-14 or later.

trans-unit.source: Value of <legacyItalic>api-version</legacyItalic> parameter
trans-unit.target: Value of <legacyItalic>api-version</legacyItalic> parameter

trans-unit.source: Version used for authentication and authorization
trans-unit.target: Version used for authentication and authorization

trans-unit.source: Version used for protocol behavior
trans-unit.target: Version used for protocol behavior

trans-unit.source: Not specified
trans-unit.target: Not specified

trans-unit.source: Version specified in the <parameterReference>sv</parameterReference> parameter
trans-unit.target: Version specified in the <parameterReference>sv</parameterReference> parameter

trans-unit.source: Version specified in the <parameterReference>sv</parameterReference> parameter
trans-unit.target: Version specified in the <parameterReference>sv</parameterReference> parameter

trans-unit.source: Any valid storage services version in format <parameterReference>XXXX-XX-XX</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: Any valid storage services version in format <parameterReference>XXXX-XX-XX</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: Version specified in the <parameterReference>sv</parameterReference> parameter
trans-unit.target: Version specified in the <parameterReference>sv</parameterReference> parameter

trans-unit.source: Valid storage services version <parameterReference>XXXX-XX-XX</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: Valid storage services version <parameterReference>XXXX-XX-XX</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: The following sample request calls <link xlink:href="fa4760a6-5343-4aa1-b484-df823ce817e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Blobs</link> with <codeInline>sv=2015-02-21</codeInline>, and without the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter.
trans-unit.target: The following sample request calls <link xlink:href="fa4760a6-5343-4aa1-b484-df823ce817e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Blobs</link> with <codeInline>sv=2015-02-21</codeInline>, and without the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the service authenticates and authorizes the request using version 2015-02-21 and also executes the operation using version 2015-02-21.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the service authenticates and authorizes the request using version 2015-02-21 and also executes the operation using version 2015-02-21.

trans-unit.source: Example 2
trans-unit.target: Example 2

trans-unit.source: The following sample request calls <link xlink:href="fa4760a6-5343-4aa1-b484-df823ce817e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Blobs</link> with <codeInline>sv=2015-02-21</codeInline> and with the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter.
trans-unit.target: The following sample request calls <link xlink:href="fa4760a6-5343-4aa1-b484-df823ce817e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Blobs</link> with <codeInline>sv=2015-02-21</codeInline> and with the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter.

trans-unit.source: Here, the service authenticates and authorizes the request using version 2015-02-21 and executes the operation using version 2012-02-12.
trans-unit.target: Here, the service authenticates and authorizes the request using version 2015-02-21 and executes the operation using version 2012-02-12.

trans-unit.source: The .NET Storage Client Library will always set the REST protocol version (in the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter) to the version that it is based on.
trans-unit.target: The .NET Storage Client Library will always set the REST protocol version (in the <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> parameter) to the version that it is based on.

trans-unit.source: Requests Via Anonymous Access
trans-unit.target: Requests Via Anonymous Access

trans-unit.source: If a request to the Blob service does not specify the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header, and the default version for the service has not been set using <link xlink:href="65424a3c-ab49-4994-865c-827409598092" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Blob Service Properties</link>, then the earliest version of the Blob service is used to process the request.
trans-unit.target: If a request to the Blob service does not specify the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header, and the default version for the service has not been set using <link xlink:href="65424a3c-ab49-4994-865c-827409598092" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Blob Service Properties</link>, then the earliest version of the Blob service is used to process the request.

trans-unit.source: However, if the container was made public with a <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link> operation performed using version 2009-09-19 or newer, then the request is processed using version 2009-09-19.
trans-unit.target: However, if the container was made public with a <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link> operation performed using version 2009-09-19 or newer, then the request is processed using version 2009-09-19.
